Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlafrentz
Reviews.Content: Very clean property, small rooms but very nice accommodations. Comfy beds. Breakfast was ok...nothing superb. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Would recommend staying here if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sally h
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Hotel Windsor Opera and were very pleased with the accomodations, price and location. The staff was very helpful and courteous. Full breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Windsor Opera Paris”
Reviews.Author: Liffeylady
Reviews.Content: First stayed here the year of the Iceland ash- chose it for proximity to Gare du Nord as we had to travel overland to it, and onwards. Liked it so much we have stayed at least 4 times since. You may not be impressed at first sighting (why don't they paint the outside) Decor of ground floor Reception and breakfast/bar area is quirky to say the least! But rooms are quite large for Paris, elegant decor, lovely bathroom and toiletries. Ask for room at front for maximum daylight. Area feels very safe despite hotel being just off a main street, in a tiny "link" street. Staff welcoming and courteous. 7/10 mins from 2 metro stations, small shops, snack bars etc. 2 mins. At least three lovely restaurants within 10/12 mins walk.- ask staff for directions.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and central. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: footprints_76
Reviews.Content: Affordable, clean and central. Room was spacious and bathroom was huge. We were on the ground floor and so breakfast preparation meant it was quite noisy, but it wasn't a big problem. We were there on business and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but a real gem.”
Reviews.Author: globbetrot
Reviews.Content: Near the Gare St-Lazaire lies the small but perfectly designed hotel WO (Windsor Opera). The rooms are small but everything to make a stay enjoyable is present : a big bed with soft mattress (reading in bed is fantastic), a flatscreen, a desk with supplies to make coffee and tea and a safe in the cabinet. The bathroom is just 1.5 m2 but everything is present. Nicely packaged shampoo, white linen and a glorious rain shower. The breakfast room in the cellar is open from 7.00 to 11.00 am. The breakfast buffet offers a wide choice. The staff is polite AND FRIENDLY. The main shopping attractions are within walking distance. The other tourist attractions are easy to visit by subway. There's a metro station with 4 lines around the corner. In this hotel the customer is king ...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and friendly”
Reviews.Author: schmida1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, well placed to walk to most places in this beautiful city. Staff friendly and helpful, rooms well appointed, especially considering the value. The hoyel is the perfect combination of funky and comfortable. No complaint from us about this hotel, and we do a LOT of travelling worldwide. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and people”
Reviews.Author: steami15
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the Hotel Windsor Opera, room was a great size, as was the bathroom, all very modern and clean. The breakfast was great every morning with plenty of variety and the service was exemplary. Our stay was 5 nights and would definitely recommend and return ourselves. Within walking distance to Metro, but in Paris you can pretty much walk anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Ladycop160
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice and clean. The location was perfect for us as it was close to 2 metro stations and for the price, we couldnt ask for more. The staff was very nice and the breakfast which was included was very good too. The bathroom was super nice and very clean and modern. The hotel is not huge but that didnt matter to us. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if on budget.”
Reviews.Author: HMSG
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel nice rooms. Metro station a block away and resturant near the hotel. Good breakfast. Had to pay 12 euros for a 3 day WiFi access. From Hotel to the Airport its about 60 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Would come back!!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel N
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located close to Gare du Nord as well as two metro stations. Though not close to the tourist attractions (i.e. Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe, Le Louvre, Champs Elysees etc), it was never an issue with the metro so close by. Just around the corner there is a great Shwarma place called Zamane for dinner (4Euro a sandwich) and a great place down the street for breakfast (approx. 2-2.50Euro for a croissant, juice and coffee). There were three of us, and the room was modern and comfortable. The staff were very welcoming, and allowed us to check in early. On a side note, I would not recommend walking by yourself at night to the hotel as it is in a side street of a major street. Overall though, we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Base of Operations, Wonderful Surrounding Area Too!”
Reviews.Author: ikea365
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during our 3 days, and 2 nights in Paris. The hotel was in a location convenient to the Metro and Gare Du Nord. We also loved the places to eat that were nearby. The neighborhood very much felt like someplace we could live, if we lived in Paris...a little like the upper east side of Manhattan. The hotel was also pretty nice. Unfortunately, we had a ground floor, street level room because we booked through europeandestinations.com and paid such an incredible price. We opted not to get the breakfast at the hotel because it's Paris and you have to try local places! The room itself was clean, cute and comfy. We aren't terribly picky people when it comes to hotels, but if you're expecting a luxury suite at the Ritz, this isn't it. It was however, perfect for a young New York couple, on a budget, since we're used to small residences and didn't need a ton of amenities. The hotel staff was helpful and friendly, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Lea B
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay ..the rooms were updated, bed was very comfortable, good size bathroom and great breakfast..close to stations and in a safe area..I would definitely recommend it..

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is so lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Shush90
Reviews.Content: I absolutely enjoyed my stay in this hotel! Staff is very friendly, room is very modern and sweet aswell comfy. I love everything about this hotel, for sure I am going to be back!

Reviews.Title: “"Lovely room, and quiet"”
Reviews.Author: Maria433
Reviews.Content: We found the staff very welcoming and helpful. The room was compact but very clean and modern with a good sized bathroom. It was a 15 minute walk from the train station, close to the undergound and about 1/2hour walk from the river. It was down a lane so very little through traffic made it very quiet. It was a little difficult to find, and a sign on the main street would have been helpful. Also I would have really loved tea and coffee making facility in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in Paris/Opera”
Reviews.Author: nathpek
Reviews.Content: We have been in Paris so many times, it's difficult to find her still beautiful - especially in summer. But we arrive with very comfortable weather and sunny enough (Paris is almost never sunny, most often overcast). We travel as a family of 4 - 2 older children. The only minus of the hotel is that is difficult to find. It's situated in a little street on Faubourg Poissoniere. We arrived by Plane to CDG and took the RER to la Gare du Nord - really cheap solution. The hotel is 10 min by foot, but we had to call the reception to receive precise direction. The staff was more than helpful. The hotel is in an old building, very quiet place, near the Blvd Faubourg Poisonniere and all its attractions and restaurants. Near the hotel there are Bars a vins (wine bars) and 10 sushi bars. The room under the roof had air conditioning and was really clean. Large room with very good beds, beautiful linen and very nice toiletteries. LAN connection for 5 EURO the night (really fast). In short, we were very please with our choice and if we ever come back to Paris - once more, The Windsor Opera Hotel will be our choice.

Reviews.Title: “what a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kathie69
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our son, daughter in law and two granddaughters for 5 days. This was a wonderful, charming hotel in a great location. Breakfast every morning was wonderful. The staff was exceptional. I lost my purse with credit cards and they took care of helping me cancel the cards. I would encourage everyone to stay at this charming boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy place in an interesting part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: shueshue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this cozy hotel during our visit to paris and found the staff to be super friendly. The hotel itself is small and is set in an "old" Parisian house. When you look out of your French windows to the buildings on the other side of the road you can see friendly tailors making all kinds of clothes. The room was nicely decorated. We did find our 4-person room to be very small for a family of 4. The bed and sleeper sofa were nearly touching each other (!!!) and there was little space to store our luggage. This wasn't really a problem for us as we only had one day in Paris and we only used the room for sleeping. I would only recommend this room for 2 people or for a family traveling with young children and only a little luggage. The breakfast was lovely and in a great "arty" setting.

Reviews.Title: “Room too small for 3”
Reviews.Author: JanineOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with my brother-in-law. We had booked a room for the 3 of us but the room we were given was a small double room with a chair that pulled out to a single bed. With the chair bed pulled out you could barely walk between it and the real bed. This was not what I expected from the online description so I checked back with the staff at the front desk who somewhat rudely told me that it was the room I had booked and they couldn't do anything about it (I think because I had booked through Expedia). Brother in law ended up getting his own room which was twice the size of ours with a separate sitting area! The location was decent - reasonably close to multiple metro and train stations but not really anywhere to eat right around the hotel. We also went the wrong way from the metro one night and ended up in a bad part of town walking past a fight in the street. Be careful when trying to judge distances on maps, Paris is huge!! The hotel and room itself were beautiful and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: LuckyRoamer
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here with two friends. Room was perfect for what we were looking for, a convenient Paris crash-pad (ie we returned very late making use of the 24hr concierge and did not wake up for breakfast). The staff were friendly and obliging, happily speaking English or indulging my bad French. The room was a decent size, comfortably fit 3 people. The room had air conditioning. Oddly the bathroom was nearly as big as the shower. In general, more than I expected from an European 3 star hotel. A few have commented on the location but have to say we found it fine. The only downside was that the room was not quite ready when we returned but that was quickly remedied. (Given average rather than good purely because we did not spend a lot of time in the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hawby
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the WHO on our Paris London excusion. This place was very nice , our room was small but very accomadating. The staff where friendly and helpful with directions and attractions. A hot breakfast was available for an additional cost but was well worth the price. The hotel it self is about a 25-30 walk from the Gare de Nord and a 10 min walk to the subway, making it easy to get to the Lourve or the tower. The hotel is definitely out of the way, down a small one way lane and even a cab driver missed the lane, but again it was easly to get around with the metro. Overall we enjoyed our saty and would do it again when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Convient Location”
Reviews.Author: Jackslade911
Reviews.Content: Location is convenient and close to many eating places. Our room was small but reasonably comfortable. There was an excellent English style breakfast. No English language television for our entire three-day stay. The entrance is off a small street that looks like an alley, however, we felt safe traversing it at night.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with Helpful & Thoughtful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Tictoc8B
Reviews.Content: Hotel Windsor Opera was meticiously clean and had a boutique type decor. The front desk was ever so helpful in guiding us to our destinations and thoughtfully arranging for transportation to the airport (thank you!) We selected this hotel based on trip advisor, a wonderful resource. Having said that, the only disadvantage to this hotel was the location. This being our first trip to Paris, we found it a bit tedious getting on the metro for a trip into the city (~20 min-30 min). In the area this hotel is located we found the streets/alleys to be unkempt with dog excrement on the sidewalks, litter and late at night the neighborhood seemed somewhat questionable and the alley the hotel is located in is dark and eerily quiet. I did learn after having visited Paris that it is best to stay in the single digit arrondissements (districts) for ease of sighseeing, I assume...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: srjparks
Reviews.Content: My 2 friends & I stayed here for 6 nights, 7 days & it was quite nice. We stayed on the top floor (4) which got a little warm at times but considering the time frame it was bearable, plus we weren't there enough to notice. The bathroom was really nice. The beds felt great. The concierge & staff were very accommodating & friendly. We were in a very good location for late night snacks as well as in relation to other parts of the city. We didn't eat there but we did use the wi-fi for like 15 per 3 days. We would definitely recommend it to 1st-timers!

Reviews.Title: “Bliss”
Reviews.Author: iamslowee755
Reviews.Content: This little gem is hidden in a quiet street on the border of the 9th and 10th. It is within a short walk of 3 different metro lines (a must in Paris). All the staff speak English and are sooooo helpful. Always available to give great advice. The hot breakfast is great. We stayed for 10 days so having a choice of fruit, yoghurt, cereals, pastries, rolls, and eggs, bacon, sausages and cold meats are great. The rooms are so quiet - the double glazing helps. It has been recently renovated so the rooms are very clean, modern and the AC works VERY well. The rooms are Paris hotel size so quite good. No free WiFi but reasonable rates - 12 Euro for 3 days. Very comfortable and a great place to return to after a big day out in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Metro, but only so so hotel and neighborhood a bit sketchy”
Reviews.Author: s2npdx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Windsor Opera in July of 2011. My wife, daughter and I. It was a 10 minute walk from the Eurostar train station, a short walk to Bonne Nouvelle's shops and Metro stations. The room was clean, the AC worked great and the breakfasts were very good. The lobby has a bit of an airplane motive with wings and propellers around. The neighborhood is a bit sketchy...a shade on the dirty side and bums sleeping on the sidewalks. The staff was nice enough, though...I thought...purposely unhelpful with questions regarding museum passes and directions to places. Room was pretty small for three of us, had no clock, no free internet and phone had no listings to call the desk. It looks like it was remodeled a number of years ago with no real attempt at upkeep after that. Again..a so so place, but close to stuff...A really nice place would be wasted as you should be spending your time seeing, doing, eating and drinking in Paris

Reviews.Title: “It was OK...”
Reviews.Author: PackMyBags65
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a family of 4 in late June 2011. It's on a small, quiet street but it's in a commercial area - a bit seedy at times with a few homeless/addicts around. Views are of the opposing building 20 feet away. The front of the hotel needs a paint job and a street sweeper. 5 minute walk to 2 different, useful Metro lines. Cute, hip lobby that you can only find in a small, boutique hotel. Crazy little old elevator that measures about 3 ft x 3 ft! The staff was VERY helpful and polite with good English. Good beds - even the fold-outs for the kids slept well. Good maid - turned on the air conditioner anticipating our return on hot days. We were in a really small room for 4 - seriously only 18 inch foot-path between all of the beds! We had to climb over our suitcases to get around. I know there are larger rooms on the top floor, but we didn't get one despite spending $3200 for 7 nights. I would never stay here again with a family unless I was guaranteed a top floor loft room! Breakfast, served in the lobby, was included in our price and it was good quality, filling, and fresh. Pastries, fresh fruit salad, cheese, cold meats, hot eggs and sausages. They want 10 euros a day for wifi access (ridiculous!) so we walked up the street and used the McD's free internet access. Room had no clock or radio but TV was adaquate to catch the news and weather. So if I had to do it all over, I would choose to stay a little closer toward the center of the city and choose a hotel with larger rooms for families. All in all it was fine but I thought it was expensive for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more or my money.”
Reviews.Author: tolcoltravalist
Reviews.Content: Older hotel with small rooms. No hotel reference books in room. Not even a TV guide or phone directory on phone. No hotel discounts offered to me regarding restaurants to dine at close to hotel. Low customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in good spot”
Reviews.Author: KLM105
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel which had nice rooms (same as depicted on hotel website) and helpful staff. The shower/bath was great and overall we had a great experience. Definitely would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, close to everything!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ErinC_711
Reviews.Content: Close to the bustling street of Bonne Novelle and Grand Boulevards, the Windsor Opera has anything you need within walking distance - Restaurants, shopping, coffee, Metro, - you can find it all there. The staff were fabulous, spoke English fluently, and the breakfast was amazing! The soaking tub in my room was an added bonus! I would definitely recommend the Windsor Opera!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: servalbear
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Windsor Opera from April 13-April 16. The hotel staff was the most helpful I have met in several travels abroad. We arrived hours before check in and left hours after check out, but the staff secured our luggage with no questions including some needing refrigeration. Whenever we asked questions, the staff was very helpful and prompt to respond. The hotel is on a quiet side street and the rooms are very soundproof. We slept great. The rooms and hotel were very clean. The room was larger than we expected and was comfortable for three adults to share. It is a short distance to a metro stop and we felt safe walking in the area any time of day or night. Their breakfast was way above standard and was a great start for each day. I have already passed on a recommendation for this hotel to friends and will stay there again when I return to Paris. Liked Best: Cleanliness and quiet Least Liked: Tiny elevator (The stairs were wide and comfortable to walk up)

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations - Staff fluent English speakers”
Reviews.Author: KipsSassa
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located to Metro stations and Gare du Norde; excellent pedestrianized area just a few blocks away, ending at Halles underground mall. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. We met up with an American friend & her daughter who were already there for a few days. Both ladies felt quite safe and secure in the hotel and walking its environs for breakfast and dinner after dark each night. Neither spoke any French, yet, they had no communication problems whatsoever and were very relaxed because all of the front desk staff were fluent in English. This was especially useful when a doctor had to be called to treat the daughter's sudden, severe illness. Our rooms on top floor were recently remodeled to a high standard. Bathrooms and fittings were very nice indeed! Only criticism was that we had booked one triple and the third bed was not a bed but an uncomfortable pull-out. (This was ok for teens, but my husband or I would NOT have been able to sleep on it.) The helpful, friendly staff and manager's excellent service more than made up for this.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectation”
Reviews.Author: Croatia_ZG
Reviews.Content: Although we really checked all infos about this hotel and expected it to be really good, it turned out that it is REALLY splendid value for money. In the area there are in fact few good 3* hotels, but Windsor Opera is quite what you're looking for - if you need a good overnight accomodation without some special needs. Staff is really nice, roooms large enough, bathroom has all necessary equipment. I stayed there with my wife & baby for few days, and we can say that it's quite a find. Only three things that can be stated as "negative" are: little breakfast lounge with often not enough space for all (avoid breakfast around 9,00 am); since hotel lobby is generaly small & breakfast is served practicaly in the lobby, during cold mornings it can be quite chilly while you're eating your breakfast. Third thing is lack of hotel bar which means your evenings can be quite calm and restful, which is a purpose of most of our private trips, isn't it? If you, on the other hand, want to have a drink, dinner or quick snack, there's a lot of that in the area. We will come back for sure to WOH.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but room and patchy service”
Reviews.Author: Travelingbiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night. It is really convenient if you arrive into Gare du Nord with the Eurostar. The hotel is a 15 minute walk away. The good points are that the hotel was recently renovated and the design is fairly stylish for a 3* hotel. The breakfast is sufficient and most of the staff are excellent. However we had a bit of a rocky start in the hotel. We arrived at 1240 and did not expect to be able to check in. The concierge told us that the room was not ready but that it would only take 30 minutes. We decided to wait in the breakfast area with a little snack but over an hour nothing happened. We overheard the receptionist speaking with the chambermaid who had not done the room. However the receptionist did not bother to tell us nor to apologize for the fact that it took much longer than expected. Again no problem if the room is not ready but one would prefer that they you straight away rather than keeping you waiting. Having said that for the remainder of our short stay the staff was very friendly. Second, it is important to be aware of the fact that some of the rooms are tiny. We stayed in 105 and while the decor was nice, it was on the small side even for Paris. In fact, it was so small that one might have difficulties placing a medium sized suitcase in the room or unpacking it into the tiny wardrobe. We did not use the Internet given that one had to purchase a special card at reception which I believe were 10 Euro for a day. Free internet would have been a nice feature and walking down to reception for an access card seems a little old fashioned. Overall, the hotel is new, quiet location and overall the service is friendly, but be aware with early check in and ensure to avoid room 105.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel that was better than its 3 star rating would have you think”
Reviews.Author: sokeeffe
Reviews.Content: Looking for a decent hotel in Paris that is not too expensive is like trying to find a needle in a haystack, and while Windsor Hotel Opera may not be that needle it is pretty close. A 10-15 minute walk from Gare du Nord and turning onto a quiet side street will find you at the Windsor Hotel Opera and its quirky decoration. With a stunning chandelier in the lobby, a reception desk that looks like it is the interior of an airplane, and a moving cloud light fitting, it is a interesting looking hotel. Once up the tiny lift that is common to all Parisian hotels and past the kooky photos of seventies cars and holiday homes you find yourself in a very reasonably sized room for a Paris hotel. With a comfortable double bed, desk, and a mini sofa-bed, my fiance and I had plenty of room to move around. An en-suite bathroom with excellent shower (as long as you are 5'6" or under!), roomy cupboard, and decent sized TV ensured the room had all you needed. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from three different metro stations (Poisonierre, Bonne Nouvelle, and Chateau d'Eau), and certainly close enough to the main drag of the Champs Elysees, Arc du Triomphe, and Louvre to be excellently positioned. We didn't partake of any room service and had little interaction with the staff to make any real comments either way. The only real let down was the lack of free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jenny3009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Opera Windsor for five nights over Christmas. The location was good & not too touristy. The staff were very helpful. The double rooms were quite spacious, particularly the corner rooms. The quadruple rooms were a tight fit. The rooms had been renovated fairly recently. They were clean & comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing little hotel”
Reviews.Author: kenc
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel purely on the strength of other Tripadvisor comments and certainly wasn't disappointed! You have to look carefully for the street in which the hotel sits as you are likely to walk past first time. The hotel has an aeronautical theme in the public areas and is quite nicely done. The bedroom was unusually big for a three-star hotel in Paris. In fact, I don't think I've had a room this big even in a four-star. The room was quite large with a separate seating area and a large settee with small coffee table. That was good. The bathroom was the next surprise. It was clean and modern and had a proper bath as well as a shower. Again, not something yuo frequently find in small hotels in Paris. There was a good mini-bar, too and a working, electronic safe. The room was warm and cosy even though it was very cold outside. As other reviewers have said, it is located only about 10 mins south of Gare du Nord. It is also handy for a number of restaurants on the Boulevards which, themselves, are only another 10 mins walk south from the hotel. The staff were polite and helpful and all spoke English. Breakfast, which was included in our rate, was very good. Most certainly better than what one normally expects in Paris. There was fruit salad, bread and pastries, cold meats and cheeses and, the first time I've seen this in Paris, a hot buffet of scrambled egg, bacon and sausages. The bacon was a bit well done but, hey!, a breakfast like this in Paris was a revelation. All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our shortt stay at this hotel and would purposefully stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “a great find”
Reviews.Author: johntissington
Reviews.Content: 10 minutes walk down from the Gare du Nord, in a quiet cobbled street. Very comfortable; well decorated; clean; and the staff are excellent. Just north of the Boulevards. Reasonable rates. We used it for the New Morning - Paris' major Jazz/ Blues venue

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Beach-N-Bostocks
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and unfortunately it was too short... however, the Hotel Windsor Opera at 10 rue Gabriel Laumain was the perfect "base camp". The room was perfect for our needs (there were 4 of us... parents & 2 adult children), the hot breakfast in the morning before our daily trek was filling, the location was quiet and away from all the "rush", but conveniently located to the Metro so getting around was not a problem. The small grocery nearby provided a nice bottle of wine and snack for our evening recap of the days adventure. So if you're looking for a nice quiet well appointed place to stay when visitng Paris... this is the best kept secret, we'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: LeeParis
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Hotel Windsor Opera. The lobby is fun with its airplane theme and the room was sleek, bright, and modern. Yet, the windows opened to a tiny street that still had a warm, older world feel. Nice. Location was terrific. Just a short walk away was a "main street" area filled with restaurants and cafes. Lots of activity. As we explored we kept finding more and more sections in the general neighborhood that had restaurants. The Bonne Nouvelle metro was a short walk away. The Chateau d'Eau was maybe 10 to 15 minutes away (at most). They were on different lines and, between the two, we got around very easily. We were in Paris for a one day transportation strike. We walked to the Louvre in under 30 minutes. We were not rushing. We also found the Opera Garnier during an evening, after dinner stroll. Again, it's really not all that far away. So, though it was my first time staying in the 10th, I was pleasantly surprised at how "close" many things were. There are a couple of little "variety" stores within a few minutes of the hotel where we got our water, Coca Lite, etc. And there was a lovely patissierie nearby with delightful pastries and even some light sandwiches that we got for a snack. We did not have breakfast at the hotel so I cannot comment on that. Oh - and the elevator is very, very tiny. Two trips - one for us and one for the luggage - was required. It wasn't a problem for us...just a fun "quirk". But if someone had to use a chair, then I'm not sure what other accommodations are available. The staff was courteous and helpful. The room was clean throughout. We really enjoyed this hotel a lot.

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem”
Reviews.Author: Davyd106
Reviews.Content: Read reviews prior to arrival and have to say I was slightly sceptical at some of the ratings. However, it did not take long to realise how accurate they actually were! A great little hotel close to several metro stations and Gare du Nord, staff extremely friendly, helpful and courteous at all times and the room was modern, clean and comfortable. Loads of restaurants and bars locally - Le Phenix just along the road is particularly good.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: ksuppo
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a contemporary decor (airplane theme) which was very fun to look at. The room was contempary, clean and a fair size (rooms in paris are generally smaller than in the US). Bathroom was very nice with towel warmer, modern bowl sink and shampoo/condidtioner/lotion provided. People at front desk were also very pleasant and helpful. The location was quiet at night, as it is not in the main touristy section of paris. It is about a 10 minute walk to the metro station. There are a few quick eat and run places to stop for breakfast or snack and several restaurants within the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and welcoming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MontyRose
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Windsor Opera a very nice hotel to stay at and the staff,especially front staff, very helpful and friendly.There was myself,my husband and 11 year old son. Akram, Greig and Katherine were always very patient and helpful. We stayed in room 203 and found it very roomy.Unfortunately we found the beds to be very hard so our nights sleep could of been better. Our thanks to Katherine for pushing us to use the Metro and it was great advice once we got over our fear of the unknown...it was brilliant!! The Hotel Windsor was about 10-15 mins train ride to Concorde station to bring you close to the Champs Elysees and Eiffel Tower ..comfortable walking distance. Greig was ever so friendly and helpful, especially when were leaving ,organising things for us always with a smile. The only down side was the beds...we found them very(hard?) firm so if you like that ..its all good. Also the breakfast..yes it was 13 euro each but we had a lovely selection,as much as we would like and didn't have to travel. We would also like to recommend a lovely and friendly cafe about 10mins max away from Windsor Opera..it is called Royal Bergere at 24 Rue Bergere,Angle Rue Trevise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - a great find! Tiny...”
Reviews.Author: mimu4
Reviews.Content: Excellent value - a great find! Tiny hotel in Parisienne side street near the opera area. Funky little lobby with helpful polite staff. Breakfast very nice with good cutlery and cloth napkins. Lovely modern spanking clean room with mini bar fridge, safe and tv. Big parisien windows, with view of quiet side street. Huge double and big single beds. Large modern spotless bathroom. Lovely toiletries,fluffy towels,hairdryer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Anna73784
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. My sister and i really loved it. The staff were always helpful, and i mean always because i dont think we could have asked them any more questions. The rooms (including the bathroom) were beautiful, modern, and spacious. The location was good too. We weren't surrounded by tourists and we weren't too far from the main sites. And most importantly we weren't too far from several different shopping areas. Oh and the breakfast was good as well. When i go back to Paris i will definitely be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: CharlesRichmond
Reviews.Content: Just returned from eight day trip to France, spending six nights with the good people at the Windsor Opera. The staff is very helpful, the hotel is clean and tastefully decorated, the neighborhood is filled with cafes, bread & pastry shops and there are a variety of places to have a nice dinner. Its convenient to several Metro stops and only a 10 to 15 minute walk from Gare d'Nord. We really enjoyed the ambience of the area, which is removed from the more touristy areas. We felt like it gave us a more authentic sense of Paris life.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: PriscillaWong
Reviews.Content: None of the usual complaint about Paris hotels applies. Space - spacious with high ceiling. Staff - extremely helpful and efficient, checked us in within 30 mins even though we arrive at 10am. Deliver an iron 5 minutes after we called. Very detailed guidance on taxi surcharges and traffic condition and what is the best way to get to airport for our very early flight. Condition of room - modern with a clean, comfortable colour scheme. spotless bathroom Location - 10 mins walk from metro station. 4 metro stops away from key shopping area of LaFayett/Printemps. Special recommendation - try the Aux Duex Canards Chez Catherine 5 mins walk from hotel for cozy French country side cooking. We would rate this small neighbourhood restaurant above many better known/guidebook recommended ones. see photos attached.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet Hotel with Brilliant Air Conditioning”
Reviews.Author: JRRKent
Reviews.Content: Modern clean hotel with good sized rooms equipped with quiet and effective air conditioning. Located on quiet backstreet so noise at night not an issue. It was only a few minutes walk to nearest Metro (5mins) or Gare de Nord (10mins). The continental breakfasts were fine (6.5 out of 10), we avoided the scrambled eggs and bacon so cannot comment but they did not look appealing. The big plus however, for this hotel is its brilliant AC just the thing for a hot night in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and clean in the 10th.”
Reviews.Author: bdkidsrn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in the 10thArr. in Paris. We chose this hotel due to proximity to our daughter who lives in the 10thArr. We were pleasantly surprised at the uniqueness, style and spaciousness of the room. Full ,modern bath, excellent furnishings and off the beaten path on a quiet street. A full breakfast was available in their dining room. Staff was efficient, courteous and spoke some English. The 10th is real Paris, great shopping, restaurants and very close to the Gare du Nord station. (easy walking distance). We will stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “paris a magical city”
Reviews.Author: DevonVacationer
Reviews.Content: Just been to Paris for 4 days. We stayed at the windsor opera. we travelled with Flybe from exeter and transferred with Paris Shuttle. The hotel was excellent, convenient for the metro, really clean, slightly quircky decor in reception, but really good. Breakast was a good choice and always plenty available. we had a superior room which was large, modern and very comfortable, also it was incredibly quiet as the hotel was on a side street. All staff were very helpful too. Flybe was very good as was Paris shuttle, no hassle from door to door. there are also a lot of restaurants in the area with prices ranging from 45euros to 125euros for 3 courses including wine.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, service, and convenience”
Reviews.Author: gdavis2533
Reviews.Content: Surrounded by good eateries and accessible closely to two metro lines. The hotel was clean and functional with quick access to all of Paris. The staff was most accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Golden701
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, and it was great. The location in good in that it is a subway ride away from anything, it is also close to restaurants and bars and walking distance to the Opera. It is on a quiet residential street. Rooms and modern and very clean, very small (like anything else in Paris) but a considerably large bathroom. Staff were also very nice and friendly. We never had breakfast at the hotel, so I really can't comment about that. Overall we would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here next time we come to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little friendly hotel in wonderful location-what a gem”
Reviews.Author: davengill9
Reviews.Content: This small and very friendly hotel in a quiet location was perfect for our needs.The breakfast was good enough to keep us going for most of the day with only a snack lunch to see us through to an evening meal.The breakfast bar was a bit small but adequate and they would lay tables in the sitting area when busy.It is located in a quiet side street so noise was kept to a minimum and the bedroom was more than adequate for the two of us(better than expected for a city centre hotel).We walked from the Eurostar Gare Du Nord station to the hotel in 20mins max and was only 30 mins to the city centre although it's better to get the metro and save your energy for sightseeing.If we were to go again we would get a metro pass so that you can have unlimited travel on underground and buses within the main city areas.The Louvre was very busy but we managed to visit others and we would recommend Musee D'Orsay,Orangerie,Arc De Triomphe and several churches including the Notre Dame.We bought the museum pass which got us in quicker than queueing for individual tickets.Didn't make the Eiffel tower as one of the lifts had broken down and wasn't prepared to queue.Food seems to be excellent wherever you go in Paris and the range of eateries in the city catered for all tastes.All in all a very enjoyable trip made even better by the warm welcome we found at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Turnipster
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Windsor earlier this month. The map on the hotel's website is rubbish - struggled to find our bearings, but with a decent map we found it within minutes. It's within easy walking distance of the Gare du Nord, Sacre Coeur and Montmartre. The Hotel is modern, very clean and quirky - in a good way!! Front of house staff were friendly & courteous. Having a two year in tow we didn't venture far in the evening, but nevertheless walking back to the hotel after dark (okay, it was only about 8.30pm), we felt very safe. We thought the hotel was good value for money (we booked through Octopus), would definitely recommend it and would definitely stay again should we make it back to Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: bellamyferdy
Reviews.Content: Best family room I've stayed in in Paris in this price range (though booked through Expedia so not the book rate!).Excellent location and in a very quiet side road. Large, modern airy L shaped room, very nice new bathroom. Excellent breakfast for a small hotel. Will definitely be back next time we come to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great value a real find in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Macfamilyd4
Reviews.Content: We ( family of 4 + Granddad) stayed in the Windsor Opera for 4 nights. The hotel is really lovely, don't let the outside put you off! Its been re-decorated in a very modern style. Our bedroom for 4 was compact but adequate in size, beds very comfortable and bathroom really modern and clear. There were plenty of clean towels and the room had everything you need. It was really quiet so sleep was great ! The breakfast area is small but there is plenty of food and lovely coffee. The staff were really helpful and friendly. The location of the hotel is very convenient, we walked from Gare Du Nord in 10 mins easily and there are 2 metro stations within 3 mins walk. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes in the area and it appeared very safe to walk around at night. We walked to the Opera area and Sacre Coer very easily from the hotel. We enjoyed our stay here and would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: 4Macks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights in December 2009 and it was great. 2 adults (in one queen bed) and 2 kids (aged 7 and 10) in a queen size fold out sofa. Hotel is situated in a picturesque narrow cobbled side street and there was no traffic to speak of and no noise (just make sure your taxi driver has a GPS or a map to find it!) It is a short taxi ride from Gare du Nord station which is where we arrived after taking the train from Charles de Gaulle Airport. We booked through GalaHotels.com and had no problems with the reservation. We arrived about 9am and were able to get into our room straight away. Breakfast wasn’t included in the room price but is well worth the extra 14 euros for adults or 7 euros for children. Cereal, fruit, baguettes, ham, salami, juices, several varieties of FRESH pastries and croissants, several hot dishes and the BEST COFFEE we tasted while in Paris. Staff very pleasant and helpful! And the chromed aircraft decor is something that has to be seen to be believed!

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain, lovely staff and comfortable Parisian touches”
Reviews.Author: traveltina418
Reviews.Content: We looked for a last minute deal in November and were paired up with this lovely hotel near everything via public transportation. We loved being close to the subway, shops, and restaurants. The staff was very helpful and made recommendations that were also enjoyable. The hotel itself was tucked away off a cobblestone road and was a lovely little mix of modern and antique (the spiral staircase is pretty cool, but there is also a one-person elevator). We included the daily breakfast and it was nice to have, but not really our style. The room and bathroom were larger than expected and everything was very clean. The only thing that I would change is the bed - it was a far cry from comfort. One tip to remember when dining in Paris: the tip is always included.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very clean hotel and friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Britsthattravel Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its good location for site seeing and weren't disappointed. The hotel was nice and clean, the room a good size and quiet. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and we would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a hotel in a lively location”
Reviews.Author: mharriman
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Paris before we were pleasantly suprised by the standard of the Windsor Opera. The hotel is very clean, breakfast was good and the staff excellent!! Great location making it affordable to eat out with lots of eateries right on the doorstep. Aux deux Canards well worth a visit. Couldn't have asked for more....a great stay and will certainly be back in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “great, quiet, hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: northernneil
Reviews.Content: when you get more than you expect you are always delighted and this is what we had here, the hotel in just off a main-ish road in a back street which meant it is very very quiet for a city centre hotel - we were waking up and not knowing what time it was. The rooms are very small but perfectly comfortable with good sized bed, flat screen TV with international channels, and a free safe. The bathrooms are fantastic with a good shower. The breakfast is not gourmet, but its perfectly fine for what you are paying - eggs and bacon precooked and kept warm and a good selection of pastries. 5 minutes walk to 2 metro stations so getting around is easy, 15 mins walk to the river.

Reviews.Title: “A nice short stay”
Reviews.Author: Thaiida
Reviews.Content: We were on our way from Barcelona back to England by train. We only stopover in Paris one night and really wanted a nice, clean, quiet, small hotel near Gard du Nord to stay - this hotel met all our requirements. The room was clean with good shower. We had two rooms on the ground floor by the road and we had a good night sleep. The fact that the hotel is on one way street must have help. Compare with our 3 very noisey nights in Barcelona where we stayed near a Tapas Bar the Windsor Opera is like haven !!!! The rooms are a bit small but we hardly spent time in our rooms apart from sleeping - it did not matter to us at all. The staff are friendly and helpful but speak English too well - we did not have much chance to practisie our French.

Reviews.Title: “Really Really Really Good”
Reviews.Author: TravelBunnySydney
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Windsor Opera Hotel in May this year, first stay in Paris and for the price we paid for the room we were not expecting much.....however....it really was great, the room was just big enough, great bathroom, bed very comfy, newly renovated and very stylish....Hotel itself is in a back lane so no views....which didnt bother us at all....location is handy walking distance to the centre of the city.....Staff were very friendly and helpful...Breakfast was very good....Not 1 bad thing to say.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, spotlessly clean and super staff.”
Reviews.Author: Dotticus
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Paris, though my first trip with my boyfriend. We picked the hotel based on reviews and the fact that it was very well priced on octopus travel. The hotel is less than a five minute walk from Bonne Nouvelle metro station, making it convenient for travelling around sightseeing. The area around has restaurants and shops, it is not too busy and we felt very safe walking around at night. We found the hotel relatively easily, though it is on a quiet sidestreet that doesn't appear on all maps. The entrance lobby is decorated in a quirky modern style. The staff were all very polite, I speak french and was looking to improve so the staff spoke clearly and slowly to help me understand which was nice, but they do also speak english. Our deal included breakfast which was served in the lobby (under the moving clouds!), it was simple but very nice. With a good selection of hot and cold food. Our room (11) was on the ground floor, this might have been annoying but since the street was very quiet with little passing traffic there was no noise at night. The room was very spacious - not just by Parisienne standards, with modern decoration, mini-bar, air conditioning and was spotlessly clean. The bathroom was a very high standard with a great shower and again very modern. I would definitely stay in this hotel again and recommend it to anyone. We went as a couple but I would go with my friends and there were also families with children when we were there. It was amazing value for money, modern, welcoming and spotless with really great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - first class service - spotlessly clean - an absolute delight.”
Reviews.Author: Hisnhers
Reviews.Content: We saw this hotel under Octopus Travel and it came up as the cheapest so assuming it wouldn't be very good we skipped on to the next one. We then did a search on the best reviewed hotel and this one came up top again - so we booked it based on travellers reviews alone. We were not disappointed. We were treated very well the room was cleaned every morning and breakfast was lovely. The most wonderful thing is that it was spotlessly clean which is really important. Staff spoke English and were really helpful and welcoming. The only thing is we had a room with no windows but there was like a decked veranda under a tall air chimney which meant we got fresh air and natural light - didn't bother us at all. We didn't use the metro at all but chose to walk down to the Seine and caught the Batobus for our sightseeing. This is like a taxi on the water - perfect for sightseeing and getting on and off. Would highly recommend it. The Hotel really made our stay enjoyable and I would def book it again.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in a very convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingFamily002
Reviews.Content: Top notch experience. Spotlessly clean, recently renovated with all new furnishings. The staff were all very helpful and fluent in English. The location was great for using the Metro. The hotel is less than ten minutes walk from three stations on three different Metro lines. The room was small as is to be expected in Paris, but the space was used very effectively. The bath was well furnished with great towels. The AC was very effective even on the days when the temps rose well into the 90's. A wonderful stay. We would defininitely stay here again and recommend this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel. Would stop here again.”
Reviews.Author: chickletStaffs
Reviews.Content: Arrived late afternoon during heatwave. Hotel took some finding as small side roads were not named on the map we had. We had got a small printout of the hotel location from hotel website but that did not show the larger roads so we then had to look at both maps to try and work what direction to go in. Took us over 20 mins to find hotel in the end so arrived hot and sweaty after pulling suitcases along aswell. Hotel is in small quiet side street in perhaps a more rundown area of Paris. Would not recommend trying to find it in the dark late at night. We were asked for credit card details and 3 digit security number to cover use of telephone and mini-bar on arrival but if you dont wish to give this you can pay a 50e deposit instead. There were 4 of us and we had asked for one room so were allocated a room in the roof space with one king size bed and two single beds that pulled out from a sofa bed. Room had velux windows so no view though this didnt really matter as there wasnt much to see anyway. As attic space room it was very hot though the hotel had done their best to try and cool it down by closing the blinds before we arrived. We were offered a smaller room on the floor below which was cooler but decided to stick it out in the room we had and indeed by the time we had come back later in the evening the room had cooled down and we had no difficulty sleeping. Room had a safe, mini-bar, internet connection but unfortunately no tea making facilities. The bathroom was very clean with towels changed daily. Beds were also made. The breakfast was 13e each - can't remember how much for children - but we decided to eat out anyway as it was cheaper. The hotel has a small lift which is supposed to fit 4 people in but think it would be a bit claustrophobic. Three of us managed to fit in though ok or one person and two suitcases. If you dont like lifts though, it is quite a climb to the top floor. Check out is by 12 on the day of departure and reception were quite happy to look after our cases until later in the day when we returned for them before catching the Eurostar back home from the Gare du Nord. Only a 10-15 mins walk back this time as we knew which way we were going. Overall a good clean hotel with all that you need for Paris break. Location is great to reach most attractions. (We easily walked to the Louvre and Montmatre. Had a taxi once from the Eiffel tower back to hotel as it was late at night and we didnt fancy the walk. This cost us 15e but otherwise we used the hop on hop off tour bus and the metro.)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DRWade
Reviews.Content: My family of two adults and two kids (16 & 13) stayed here 7/28/09-8/2/09 (had one quad room). Here's my quick review: ++wonderful staff, nicely decorated, clean rooms, good very firm beds (even the sofa beds were good for my kids), our windows opened to a quiet street/alley (Rue Gabriel Laumain), located in a calmer part of the city than some areas, good breakfast buffet --was difficult to find--even the cab driver didn't know exactly where it was located (Rue Gabriel Laumain is located off of the main road called Poissonnierre Blvd); even though the metro is located only a few minutes walk from the hotel, it still takes about 30 minutes to get to the major attractions Overall, this hotel is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in fabulous paris”
Reviews.Author: yorkshirepug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in July 2009, and thoroughly enjoyed it. The hotel itself is, as previous reviewers have stated, in a quiet one way street, in a slightly run down area, but very convenient for the Gare de Nord (10 minutes walk) and the metro (5 minutes). It is fairly recently renovated, and very smart. We shared a family room with our quite tall teenagers, and all 4 beds were comfortable, and although there was not much space left around the beds, we did not spend a lot of time in the room. Breakfast was included in our deal (booked with Airmiles), and it was perfectly sufficient for our needs, with bacon and scrambled egg, in addition to cereals, cooked meats and, of course, croissants. The staff were all welcoming and helpful, and tolerated our (not very good) French too. Paris itself was wonderful, and we ate out in various parts of the city, and found that the hotel was easy to get back to at any time of the day or night. We would strongly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ituassu
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very cleanApartments always clean, educated employees, especially Vincent and Angela, breakfast great, near the gallery Lafaiete the Opera of Paris and close to main sightss,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, modern, clean, luxurious, convenient but not nicest location”
Reviews.Author: hjj09
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel: clean, modern, spacious, comfortable beds, friendly staff, safe, trendy, quiet rooms. We got a reduced rate from expedia.ca and you definitely get what you pay for in this tres chic hotel! Lovely. Only downside is the location. While it was convenient to walk to the metro and from there go all over Paris, the neighbourhood of the hotel itself is not exactly upscale...but a hotel like this in many of the other arrondisements would probably be double the cost! Great, inexpensive Lebanese food place just around the corner: Zamane (34 rue du Faubourg Poissonnier - 75010).

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, friendly staff, decent location, decent value for a Parsian (small) hotel room”
Reviews.Author: Manley52
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, and no problems getting checked in. As expats living in Europe we drove to Paris, so you could miss the street. The hotel is on a quiet avenue, and is a 2 minute walk from the very English speaking friendly Underground. The room itself was for two people, with a roll in double placed for the 10 and 11 year old boys. So space was somewhat an issue, but again, the price was right, and who spends all their time in a hotel room , when you should be experiencing Paris. The Staff was very accomodating. Did not have the breakfast so i can not comment. As for nightlife around the hotel, there are theaters, cafes and restaurants a short walk away. There is also a convience store that sells snacks, sodas, champagne (its Paris) and beer right at the end of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: NCIceman
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel on a one way street in Paris. This cuts down on noise but can make the hotel difficult to find. We stayed here for one night prior to leaving the city to explore the French countryside. I wish we could have stayed longer. The manager on duty during our stay, Vincent, was a real traveler's friend. The room was modern although small. It was spotlessly clean.

Reviews.Title: “A restful & delightful place in the center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: etienne0710
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Tripadvisor, I had - finally in Paris - a wonderful hotel experience, with the Windsor Opera. The hotel has been renovated in good taste with a touch of originality for the reception desk and the breakfast room (furnished with amazing planes spare parts!) People are nice, the room was very quiet... I felt relaxed after my night. Last but not least; I was with my 6 years old daughter in our double twin and she wants to come back because "C'était super chouette et les saucisses au petit dejeuner sont vachement bonnes". What else ?

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Melbournian3
Reviews.Content: We had trouble finding a triple room in Paris that didn't cost a fortune so we were very happy when we found Windsor Opera. The rooms were comfortable, clean, modern and spacious. Staff at reception were extremely friendly and very helpful with any questions we had. The location was great, not far from the metro which will get you to any location in Paris in minutes. Must say be careful of pickpockets on Metro, we did see them in action, however very safe to use if you have some awareness. We were only able to stay a couple of nights in Paris but thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Would definitely recommend Windsor Opera and would stay there again but hopefully a little longer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mylh
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 1 night during my business trip to Paris. Hotel is located on a quiet street not far from city center, 15 min walking. Room were surprisingly big with new furniture. Most of all I enjoyed bathroom that was very mordern and stylish. The only minus is the price wich is quite high.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable, pleasant, helpful, surprising hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: julesflan
Reviews.Content: Myself and four girlfriends stayed here for a birthday weekend away, the pictures on the internet do not do it justice, it was more like a 4 star hotel than 3. The rooms were fabulous, spotlessly clean, warm and the fixtures and fittings were very high spec, all chrome and glass, the bathrooms were georgeous, bedlinen and towels were brand new, big fluffy white towels and the sheets were spotlessly clean. The staff were very helpful and couldn't do enough for us, the breakfasts were lovely, plenty to choose from and I must say their French coffee was fabulous, we had a brilliant time just a pity about the Euro!

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor, stay here and they'll do the rest”
Reviews.Author: waywardseattle
Reviews.Content: We are three "mature" ladies from the US. We were delighted to find our room to be large and had separate beds. Deep, luxurious bathtub, lots of hot, hot water, clean, clean, clean. We were thrilled. We ended up walking all over the city and taking the subway home each evening. Bonn Nouvelle, come out and turn down our street at MacDonalds, turn in at the archway. How easy can that be? The Vincente or Eric marked a map each day for our desired adventure. They wrote down directions, subway numbers. After the first afternoon, we felt we had the historic part of the city figured out. They suggested a tourist boat cruise the first day to orient ourselves to the various points of interest. Perfect The breakfast was hot, good and plentiful. Coffee made to order. We consider ourselves budget travellers, but enjoyed the special attention they gave us, including the dinner reservation at Flo. We absolutely would recomment the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the location...”
Reviews.Author: TwoUKtravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days in October 2008. It was an easy walk from the Gare du Nord on arrival and a short walk from the Metro in order to get around each day. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as we always ate at one of the little cafes nearby. Our room, on the first floor, was very modern and immaculate with good ventilation and a lovely bathroom in which we could open the window. The room and bathroom were a good size considering we were very central and rooms are often small. The location is also quiet at night as it is on a little side street. The staff were always helpful and it was no problem to leave our luggage with them once we had checked out on our last morning and to collect it later in time for our flight. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for stomping around Paris”
Reviews.Author: Optimus_Lime
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in one of the family rooms, plenty of space for 2 adults and 2 children. Excellent location for train station and walking into the City, plenty of restaurants/cafes in the area to suit all tastes and budgets. Excellent staff, although we opted out of the breakfasts €13 for adults and €7 for children instead taking in the local cafe or chomping on a baguette for €1, Will stay again next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great value, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Jonescliff
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and everything about the hotel was very good. The reception and friendliness of the hotel staff was outstanding, the location good for Gare du Nord and for sight seeing in the centre of Paris. The room was of a very high standard and the cleanliness of the hotel matched that of any I have stayed in as an experienced business traveller. Little details such as the aircraft theme and moving clouds in the reception area really make this hotel stand out. The only thing that wasn't great was that the breakfast was a little limited however this was a very minor negative point.

Reviews.Title: “Great find, great coffee”
Reviews.Author: gordy1210
Reviews.Content: Great to find a lovely hotel in Paris that lives up to expectations. Room (quad) v comfortable, coffee at breakfast best we got in Paris. Very handy for Gare du Nord- we walked with luggage in no time. Metro just up the road and a couple of reasonable restaurants on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel, highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Charphi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was described as a 5 out of 5 hotel by previous reports on Tripadvisor, so we went with the recommendation. The hotel was in a fantastic location with easy walking to lots of attractions, especially the Louvre, Gare du Nord and the Bonne Nouvelle metro station which was just a few minutes walk. The hotel was lovely, the staff wonderful and so helpful and the rooms fantastic. We went with the recommendation, you should too. We paid £90 per night and would have easily paid more. We will definitely be going to Paris again and will be staying at the Windsor Opera Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superdupa terrific hotel, with warm, funny and welcoming staff!”
Reviews.Author: miss_teaplease
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for myself my sister and my mother. We stayed in a tripple room with breakfast included for two nights and I have to say this was a fantastic experience. The staff were really attentive and even managed to find a birthday cake for me, when all the local pattisseries were closed. The hotel is expertly decorated, close to the Louvre and Gare du Nord station, with easy access to the rest of the city. This was my first time in Paris and I was worried about people being rude (so i'd heard) and hotel rooms being small and cramped...this most certainly was not! The bathroom was big enough, with a bath and great design, the rooms were cleaned everyday and we really did feel like we were coming home at the end of the day. They made our stay really special and also recommended a local restaurant that was delicious....I can't rave about this hotel enough...anyone going to Paris should stay here. Excellent value for money, exceptional staff, cutting edge decor and close to all the action. A 3* hotel that deserves a higher rating!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid”
Reviews.Author: skydeeva
Reviews.Content: This was quite a charming little find. The hotel has been completely refurbished. Wonderful location, quick access to wonderful cafes nearby. Easy walk to the Tour Bus Stop! Best for site-seeing. Well lit, yet off of the beaten path. The Gar de Nord Train station is a 15 - 20 minute walk for city dwellers. I would suggest that you catch a taxi if you have bags. The hotel is very clean. Wonderful employees. The entire lobby looks like the inside of an airplane. The continental breakfast is not necessary. If you are traveling with young children, Starbucks and McDonalds are a 10 minute walk. The Starbucks shuts down a bit early. There are several little bodega/grocery stores within a 2 to 3 minute walk. There is an internet cafe about 7 minutes away. Cost is relatively cheap. According to Vincent (The Owner) - The Television in your room will have your language of origin upon checkin. That was the only item that was not yet working. I have stayed in Hotels all over the world. This one is a great find for the money.

Reviews.Title: “charming and enchanting”
Reviews.Author: ursulahemard
Reviews.Content: Charming, charming, charming....bewitched or enchanted, both you will be, as were my Prince Charming and I! This is exactly the place where Gary Cooper would have invited Audrey Hepburn for a little "Love in the Afternoon" coz the Ritz lost its discretion nowadays. In the middle of Paris, just 2 blocks from the "Grands Boulevards" and 10 min. walk from the "Opera Garnier", in a quiet, secluded and very characteristic old street of Paris, I have found this hidden and newly renovated, freshly refurbished Boutique Hotel. The lobby already enthralls with its Eiffel glass roof and the reception area captures ones attention with the very imaginative decoration of an authentic Boing 747, which gives you the illusion of still walking in the clouds. The rooms are very spacious, immaculate and decorated with love and care, keeping the typical parisian style but upgraded with a modern minimalist flair. The colors are especially very subtly chosen, a palette of pastel, implying tranquility and sensuality. Brand new bathrooms, with an agreeably surprising good water-pressure, and there is even place for two!...under the shower I mean! Charming, once more, as well as prompt, the staff with its fluent english, alluring French accent and unmissable avant-garde French poise...c'est la vie en rose... The croissants I degusted are exquisite, especially dipped into my "chocolat chaud" , languishing still in bed, whilst I was scanning through the freshly delivered "Herald Tribune", as Breakfast is taken by the classy epicurean French always in bed! Do as the French do, before darting in a new day of Parisian exploration... For families, or more conventional lovers, there are also rooms with connecting doors and an elaborate breakfast buffet.... TV & Wifi, are there, but I suggest you ignore it if you can, and just enjoy your stay at this delightful Hotel and make the best out of it!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Cindymunky
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on previous TA reviews, the hotel website and location and were not disappointed! The location is great: We easily walked to Notre Dame and the Louvre from the Hotel and there are metro stations very nearby. It's on a quiet side street so you don't suffer from the noise of the main roads, yet you're still really close to local shops, restaurants and bars. I would suggest printing a street map off the internet before travelling though, as the street is quite well hidden! It doesn't appear on guide-book maps and even the locals couldn't tell us where it was! Luckily, another hotel gave us a detailed map and directions. The staff are friendly and accommodating. We arrived 2 hours before check-in and our room was already prepared and they happily let us check in early. Also, upon check-out they were happy to hold our suitcases for us as we had a late flight. Can't fault the service at all! The hotel itself has been recently renovated and looks stunning. The decor is similar to what you would find in any decent boutique hotel and we felt really comfortable there. We stayed in room 15, which is a very good size with the biggest Parisian bathroom I've ever seen! (In my experience they're usually the size of a broom closet) The bathroom was amazing: A massive wet-room style shower that easily fit 2 people and a huge shower head that delivered plenty of steaming hot water. Towels and complimentary toiletries were changed every day and the towels also seemed brand new - fluffy and gorgeous! The bedroom was just as good with a big comfy bed, dressing table, flat-screen tv, wardrobe, mini-bar and free safe. It also had a digital thermostat so it was super easy to get the room temp you wanted. And it was all decorated in a stylish, modern, comfortable way. We didn't take advantage of the 13 euro breakfast as there were plenty of local eateries to explore, but it looked delicious with a range of bread, croissants, cold meats, cheeses, fruit, yogurt, cereals and juices. If we went back with a bigger budget, we'd definitely eat at the hotel! The only vaguely negative aspect was that our room was on the ground floor and the french doors led to a tiny courtyard with high walls all around, so light in the room wasn't brillient. this didn't bother us in the slightest but is not ideal for people wanting a view. Saying that, I'm not sure how many (if any) other rooms had this lack of view! We've stayed in Paris a few times now and this is by far the best hotel we've been to and we'll definitely stay here next time and recommend it to our friends. 100% happy!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous refurbished hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMSTravels
Reviews.Content: Lovely. Just refurbished. Everything new and clean. Comfortable bed, flatscreen TV. Really helpful reception who gave us excellent restaurant recommendation. The area it's in is not fantastic but it's a little way off the street and so very quiet.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Windsor Opera
HotelInfo.Address: 10 rue Gabriel Laumain, 75010 Paris, France
